> [[ Offensive Mastery 1 offers a choice from: ]]
* Concussive Strike // Active // Spend PP to make an attack that deals increased damage and can knock targets back a significant distance. Required for: "Overpower", "Charge", "Whirlwind Attack".
* Critical Threat // Passive // Slightly increases critical strike range. Required for: "Fleshrend", "Unarmed Fighter".
* Weapon Mastery // Passive // Increases the effectiveness of wielded weapons. Required for: "Two-handed Mastery", "Dual Wield Mastery", "Whirlwind Attack".

> [[ Defensive Mastery 1 offers a choice from: ]]
* Iron Body // Passive // Reduces incoming damage. Required for: "Panacea", "Combat Regeneration".
* Lightning Reflexes // Passive // Increases dodge chance. Required for: "Evasion", "Retaliate", "Intercept".
* Shield Mastery // Passive // Increases the effectiveness of shields. Required for: "Shield Slam", "Shield Wall", "Intercept", "Deflect Projectiles".

> [[ Movement Mastery 1 ]]
* Sprint // Active // Spend PP to temporarily increase running speed, allowing incredible feats of movement. Required for: "Combat Respiration", "Instantaneous Movement".
* Expedited Maneuvers // Passive // Increases effectiveness of recovering while prone, as well as such feats as grappling and disarming. Required for: "Recovering Strike", "Fading Strike".
* Haste // Passive // Chance to gain bonus attack speed when striking. Required for "Flurry of Fists", "Phantasm Strike".

> Spend a point on HP.
> Spend a point on PP.
> Spend a point in Sabers.
> Spend a point in Unarmed.
> Spend a point in Offensive Mastery.
> Spend a point in Defensive Mastery
> Spend a point in Movement Mastery.

> [[ If Mastery wins, a sub-vote will begin with options for Ability choices. Please do not pair your vote with a vote for a specific Ability, or it will be ignored. ]]

37760732.name: BSO
37760732.comment:
>>37760709

It's a little while before she arrives, rushing into the cave in a bit of a hurry. The four of you are seated at various points on a rock formation, overlooking another of the small waterfalls from above, and you turn to spectate her approach.

"You alright?" You ask.

"Crawlers." Ayla responds. "They seem a little worked up."

There's an awkward pause, before she continues. "Well, it's your party. Want to introduce me?"

"It's Nel's party." You correct her, hoping you might cheer the kid up a bit. "Nel?"

"Along with Ascheritte, Tatsumaki's our heavy hitter," Nel says, gesturing to the cat-eared girl who smiles and waves in response. "She doesn't speak English well."

"Ah! I haven't seen many unarmed fighters. What level?" Ayla asks, leaning down to Tatsumaki's height. There's no response; the brawler just tilts her head, giving an inquisitive look before she rephrases the question. "Uhm. Levels. How many levels?"

"Ah... five." Tatsumaki responds, quiet as ever.

"I'm Nel," The roguish kid continues. "And our gunner is Vision. You're?"

"Ayla." Ayla smiles. "Just a Tech from the city."

"With her name on an Altar." Vision says, mouth curling into a frown. "You're one of the Alliance leaders, aren't you?"

"Guilty as charged. Something wrong with that?"

He scoffs. "Of course not."

"Right..." Ayla folds her arms. "So, we're bound for the ruins, then. Anyone been before?"

> Listen to the party's opinions.
> Discuss characters' capabilities.
> Discuss strategy. (Write-in)
> Head down for some cursory exploration.

"I've been down once, and it went well. But I'm not sure what to expect from it now." Nel straightens up a bit. "Things are more dynamic than I expected. I got caught off guard."

"There's a few different types of monsters down there, I'm aware." Ayla asks. "What do you know about them?"

"There's Guardian Constructs, which are like, sandstone and obsidian statues. Some of them are like soldiers, but there are some pretty large ones too." Nel says. "My party didn't even bother fighting them. They're too big, too slow, and too hard to kill. There's also these big lizards in the lower parts that have some camouflage ability."

"Any spellcasters?"

"Not that I'm aware of."

"Alright, we'll probably want to have a contingency plan, for if something's changed." Ayla folds her arms. "Try to stay adaptable, everyone got that?"

"What can we all do?" You ask. "I think I'm pretty fast. A bit defensively-oriented, but I can dish out some pretty serious damage. I'm level 3."

"Same here." Vision says. He's still glaring at Ayla out of the corner of his eye. "I can barely take a hit, but this caster does hella damage."

"Tatsumaki is level 5, and I'm level 4." Nel says. "I'm an Explorer. Been playing as sort of an ambush attacker, and hoping to use my secondary to get some offensive abilities. I can move pretty quick, climb, and use items faster than normal."

"We can work with that." Ayla says. "Levels only give you a big advantage compared to eachother if you've got a lot of them, depending on what abilities you pick. It's a trade-off between skills, Masteries, and HP."

"What can you do?" Nel asks.

"I'm a Technician, like I said." She responds. "Level 9. I'm specializing in larger builds as opposed to drone fighting, but I've got a couple of casters and a decent melee weapon to switch between."

"Do you think you can take a look at my weapon?" You ask, showing your scimitar. "I think it's damaged."

37762484.name: BSO
37762484.comment:
>>37761707

You're not sure how you'd go about activating this ability anyway. You focus, attempting to meditate on some purpose, but produce nothing. You think you feel something, a warmth, echo from inside you. You recall the feeling inherent in discovering a Celestial Gem, of breathlessness and utter need. Nothing happens.

"You've never seen a skill like that before?" You ask.

"I can't say that I have, Ascheritte. No one's mentioned it to me before."

"Right, uhm. Never mind, I think I might have been misreading." You say, coming to your senses. "Ayla, can you identify some items for me?"

"That's an Artificer ability, I'm afraid." She frowns. "I would if I could, though."

"Alright." Nel says. "We've got a full team. Is everyone ready?"

Another open bridge through thick fog, then the tunnels close up into a dark column, a stone ramp that spirals downward about a thick pillar. You can't see well, and descend deeper. Nel's voice echoes from in front of you. "There's a big building down here with a branch we didn't check out last time."

He leads you to a way out, directly ahead. Water pours from cracks in the ceiling, and massive glowing bricks of quartz piercing the stone above allow light to bleed through, illuminating disheveled grass platforms that form a walking surface. Ahead, a sandstone cathedral is embedded into the cave surface, as if an entire building sunk undamaged from many layers above.

"It's beautiful." Ayla says, moving to your side. Tatsumaki and Vision follow closely behind.

"Don't let your guard down, darling." comes Vision's reply.

There's a pair of staircases leading up to the building. In front of them, a pair of statues stands: pike-wielding obsidian humans in armor and helmets, with faintly glowing eyes visible even from here. A campfire burns a little ways ahead, off to the side in the nook of a rock spire. It looks like there's another adventuring party down here.

What will you do?
> Other

"Let's take out those Constructs by the entrance." You suggest, stashing your scimitar and wielding the pickaxe. It's quite heavy, but you think you can manage; you'll just need a different approach to combat. "Keep an eye on those four by the fire."

"Vision, can you land a shot from here to pull them over?" Ayla asks. He's already got his longcaster out, and looses a bolt at the one on the left. It hits, blowing the stone helmet clean off the thing, and the pair is slow to react.

They turn towards you, and begin lumbering down the stairs. Alerted by the sound of gunfire, the adventurers off to the side are watching, moving a bit closer to the adjacent cave wall even though they're already clear of the battlefield.

Nel is sneaking off to the side, and Tatsumaki is ducked low to the ground; it looks like she's about to charge. The Guardians reach the bottom of the stairs, and Ayla produces a pair of handcasters. They've got a faster rate of fire than you're familiar with, and she unleashes a wide spray of bolts at the approaching soldiers.

They seem pretty damn durable, though. They splash into the falling water with heavy footsteps and level their pikes for a charge, albeit slow.

> Take a running swing at the closest Guardian.
> Move ahead, and get ready to intercept.
> Wait, and let the ranged attackers do their damage.

> [[ 48 ]]

It's like you're acting on a different timescale than those around you. You feel it might have hit you under normal circumstances, but the closer the spear-point draws to your abdomen, the the slower it seems to travel. You step to the side, and continue moving unfazed, raising the weapon overhead for a strike.

> [[ 1 ]]

Oh god, this thing is fucking heavy.

The pick slips from your hands completely, tumbling forward and smashing into the guardian's face hard enough to knock off his helmet. It bounces skyward in apparent defiance of the laws of physics, and splashes down into the water nearby.

"Get your shit together, kid!" You hear Vision shout as you scramble backwards to duck away from another stab.

Then, a pulse of red light briefly encircles your form. Haste.

A quick step back, as Nel approaches from behind, shoving the thing to the ground. At a loss for options without your scimitar in hand, you stomp it--again, and again, before it feels like you should be able to react, until it remains motionless in the cold, ankle-deep water.

> Tatsumaki defeated Guardian Construct. [[ Party: Vision, Nel, Ascheritte, Ayla ]]
> Ascheritte defeated Guardian Construct. [[ Party: Vision, Tatsumaki, Nel, Ayla ]]

Alright, that didn't go quite as well as expected. The other party is giving you strange looks.

"Sorry," You shake your head. "I wanted to try that pickaxe, but it really sucks."

"It'll probably do more damage than slashing against these things," Ayla shrugs, moving to recover it for you. "But I'd understand if you didn't want to use it."

What will you do?
> Approach the other party. (Write-in.)
> Investigate the cathedral.
> Other.

A quick step back, as Nel approaches from behind, shoving the thing to the ground. At a loss for options without your scimitar in hand, you stomp it--again, and again, before it feels like you should be able to react, until it remains motionless in the cold, ankle-deep water.

Tatsumaki's beaten you to one of the stone pair. She's standing at attention with an obsidian spear, wearing a cracked, oversized stone helmet that looks like it's weighing her down a bit, and looking at you with a toothy smile.

You heft one of the pikes. It's heavy and a bit unbalanced, but the point looks savage. Doesn't seem terribly useful, but could probably do a lot of damage if thrown or prepared against a charging attack.

"Stone." Nel says. "They don't drop much of anything worthwhile."

"These might come in handy, though." You suggest. "I'm gonna hold onto it. Tatsumaki, you should do the same, alright?"

She gives you a thumbs-up with her free hand. Ayla hands you your pickaxe with a grin; you groan as you accept it, then finish looting the defeated stone guardian.

> [[ Inventory - guardian construct ]]
cracked stone helm

"Anyone want this?" You ask.

"Nah," Vision says. "Looks like junk."

You add it to your inventory and move on, drawing closer to the ancient stone edifice.

From here, you take a look at the party nearby, sizing up the members, in particular, keeping a close eye on the one in the back, without a UI. He's wearing heavy-looking armor, armed with a spear, and has a pair of guardian stone pikes tossed over his back. He doesn't look out of place, and mustn't be, if he's traveling with a party. But you've learned to distrust the Nameless, for better or worse; anyone among them could be a member of Freakshow, or a PKer waiting to strike.

>>37764941

There's another one, wearing a large, white hooded cloak, who's been watching the five of you since you first made yourselves known. She's lithe-looking, with long, braided hair. Some sort of creature is sitting on her shoulder, with a strange, shimmering band wrapped about its neck. A familiar of some sort? You didn't think players could have pets.

You can see into the cathedral through windows and gaps in the stone as you ascend the staircase. Additional sets of stairs to your left and right lead to high entrances; there's an upper walkway, a second floor that leads around the cathedral's perimeter, with guardian constructs in the corners. You think you see outer doorways as well. There could be an external balcony, looking out over an abyss, or the place could just be completely entrenched in stone.

How deep do these caves go, anyway?

Immediately in front of you, a set of stairs heading down leads to a dim floor, the auditorium where the congregation would sit in a modern church. You hear the distant sound of hooves on a stone floor, drawing occasionally closer and further.

What will you do?

"Let's clear out the Guardian Constructs on the upper floors so we don't have to deal with them later." Someone suggests. You move toward the first as a group, electing to wield your scimitar this time. It's dark on the upper cathedral floor, and there's an echo, a pronounced hollowness as you make your way inside.

> [[ Ancient Cathedral // PVP Disabled ]]

A ping; you recall you gain experience for discovering locations, but have yet to level again.

You can see down into the atrium through archways that line the long walkway. Nel is moving cautiously below, and it looks like he's got some kind of menu open on his UI. There's rows of stone benches, and the stomping hooves seem a bit louder, as you can hear them echoing around you.

You approach a Guardian Construct in the corner. Vision takes initiative, opening fire, and Tatsumaki makes her way forward. They've got its attention, and this time, you try to focus on the joints. It does appreciable damage; you don't carve right through the stone, but don't expect to.

> Ascheritte defeated Guardian Construct. [[ Party: Vision, Tatsumaki, Nel, Ayla ]]

There's one at each corner, and you probably have enough time to take all four out before Nel finishes.

> Try using the pickaxe again.
> Practice with the pike.
> Stick with the scimitar.

You rush forward, pike ready. The next soldier is one of sandstone, but seems brittle on the inside, as your weapon breaks through.

"Just more of these goddamn spears and helmets." Vision sighs.

You stash a second pike, and give another to Tatsumaki, who's stored hers in her UI already. You swing the weapon around a bit, to get a feel for it; you wonder how effective a phalanx would be in this game, and are briefly amused by the thought.

> [[ UI Messenger - Nel ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Are you done yet?
> [[ Nel ]]: 1sec
> [[ Nel ]]: ok
> [[ Nel ]]: i know where he is
> [[ Nel ]]: there's like an underground walkway down here
> [[ Nel ]]: and i think the atrium wall could open somehow
> [[ Nel ]]: if we lure the boss out here we'll probably have an easier time
> [[ Nel ]]: i think it would kill us in close quarters
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Point taken. Come up, there's a room we need you to check out.
> [[ Nel ]]: k omw :)

A little bit of time passes before he rounds the corner to the upper walkway and sees you through the arches from across the atrium. He begins to yell, but quiets himself and jogs over.

"There you guys are." He nods. "The area map isn't super useful, but I'll put it up in our party stuff."

"What did the boss look like?" You ask. "Get a good look?"

"It's an obsidian pegasus, alright. Looks like it's got hella wingspan." He responds. "No vital points, by the looks of it. It'll be a tough fight."

"Sounds like we'll have to chip away at the thing. I wasn't expecting anything else." Ayla says. "I've got an explosive, if we can stun or corner it."

"You didn't tell us about this?" Vision growls.

"I didn't think it'd be super important, sorry." She rolls her eyes. "It's not even that big."

"What did you guys need?" Nel asks.

"This room," You say, gesturing to the door. "Mind having a look inside?"

"On it. Watch my back, okay?" He says, and slips through the entrance.

"S'alright." You nod. You can't help but feel a bit jealous. "That's what picking up a Gem feels like."

He looks at you like a deer caught in the headlights.

"Another one?" Ayla and Vision speak in unison, the former with curiosity, the second with anger.

"Yes, okay." Nel responds.

"Two Celestial Gems between you already..." Ayla sighs. "Liza didn't use many more than that to create her Artifact, though she and her guild have worked on it a lot since. You could definitely have something minor conjured up, or boost something you already have..."

"Let me see it." Vision nods, extending a hand toward Nel.

"I don't think that would be for the best." Ayla intervenes, standing in his way. He groans. It seems to upset him again.

"But I promise," Nel says. "The chest was empty when I got there. No weapons, not even a cred-chip. This thing was wedged in the damn ceiling. I couldn't help it, I had to..."

"We know, don't worry." Ayla says. "We'll talk about it later, alright?"

"Yeah, okay."

You push open the door and make your way into the room. The stone floor is cracked and damaged, and rows of broken and overturned bookshelves render the large area in aisles, some sort of derelict library. Books lie face-down in the floor, or stuck to shelves, caked in mold, and much of what's left looks like it's been burned or deliberately destroyed.

"I might take a few of these back. I don't think the developers would go as far as to make their own language..." Ayla kneels to inspect a moldy tome. If they could really affect your minds, they wouldn't have to. "But maybe some people at the hall would be interested."

You wander forward, noting a wide-open wooden lockbox at one end of the room. Above it, a very water-damaged painting on the wall depicts a lush landscape with light bursting forth from the ground; from the sky above, enormous creatures, dragons, dive down from the sky, besieging this underworld influence. There's spaces in the dust along the wall where you can see other paintings of similar size have been taken.

What will you do?
> Suggest you get ready to take on the boss.

"Where'd you find the gem, Nel?" You ask.

"There," He gestures to the ceiling. "By the chandelier."

"Mm..." Doesn't seem like there's any uniformity. They could be anywhere, and whoever beat you here seems to have taken up art thievery. You motion to the Writ Keepers' leader as you heft the washed-out painting off the wall. "Ayla, think this painting means anything?"

"Anything that depicts the surface so clearly might have meaning." She suggests. "I'm not sure if it's worth much, though. It looks pretty damaged; whoever beat us here just sort of glazed over it."

"Hold onto it for now. Don't worry, our UIs can hold a lot."

You dig around in the room, but don't seem to find a whole lot of anything else. Ayla stashes a few more books. Tatsumaki seems awfully bored.
